adrFormatAddress: 130 LENOX AVE. BTWN, 116TH AND, E 117th St, New York, NY 10026, USA

originalText.text: Very poor experience. I was told I did not qualify for the Covid 19 antiviral treatment (I seemingly received the wrong information). When I asked why I did not qualify the provider was short, dismissive and scolded me. Then she stood up, canceled my appointment and walked out of the room mid question. The entire interaction lasted less than 2 minutes which you can see in my canceled appointment records. Extremely disrespectful. I won’t pretend to know the reason she was so uninterested in interacting with me and helping me or at least thoroughly explaining my treatment options but if this clinic is not prepared to provide actual care to the patients that live here then it should not be in my neighborhood.

originalText.text: Save your time and go to a “real” doctor’s office. After a less than compassionate assessment, I was sent home with negative COVID and flu tests and some weak AF cough med that did nothing for me. Felt like something was still really wrong and went to my PCP today (2 days later)… I have pneumonia. If you work in healthcare, the bare minimum should be to care.

originalText.text: I booked an ear wax cleaning appointment on 3-July-2021 and visited the clinic on 6-July-2021. NP Lydia was extremely polite, thorough and caring. She even called me up 4 days later to check in on me again. Impressive! It's imprudent to expect Minute Clinics to offer ER-level services but for relatively straightforward ailments, this is an incredibly quick option (in comparison, my ENT had an appointment wait time of 2 months!).

originalText.text: CVS MinuteClinic fills a big health-care gap, but the best part of their services is the wonderful Lydia Peavy, a brilliant medical professional who is attuned to her patients. She put me at ease immediately--with skill at procedures and great empathy. I would return in an instant--highly recommended for adult and child medical care.

originalText.text: Rudest "doctor" I've ever visited. Doesn't care about their patients and will try to diagnose you before you even enter the room and tell you you are not sick. If you feel horrible and need medicine, GO SOMEWHERE ELSE!! you will save time, money, and energy.
